article.citation: Overington JP, Al-Lazikani B, Hopkins AL: How many drug targets are there? Nat Rev Drug Discov. 2006 Dec;5(12):993-6.
Imming P, Sinning C, Meyer A: Drugs, their targets and the nature and number of drug targets. Nat Rev Drug Discov. 2006 Oct;5(10):821-34.

polypeptide.name: Cytochrome c-552
polypeptide.specific-function: Catalyzes the reduction of nitrite to ammonia, consuming six electrons in the process (PubMed:9593308, PubMed:11863430, PubMed:18311941, PubMed:20629638). Has very low activity toward hydroxylamine (PubMed:11863430). Has even lower activity toward sulfite (PubMed:20629638). Sulfite reductase activity is maximal at neutral pH (By similarity).

polypeptide.name: Cytochrome c2
polypeptide.specific-function: Cytochrome c2 is found mainly in purple, non-sulfur, photosynthetic bacteria where it functions as the electron donor to the oxidized bacteriochlorophyll in the photophosphorylation pathway. However, it may also have a role in the respiratory chain and is found in some non-photosynthetic bacteria.

polypeptide.name: Cytochrome c-550
polypeptide.specific-function: Low-potential cytochrome c that plays a role in the oxygen-evolving complex of photosystem II (PSII). Required for normal function or stabilization of PSII. Extrinsic protein associated with PSII that enhances oxygen evolution.

polypeptide.name: Cytochrome c-552
polypeptide.specific-function: Mediates the electron transport between the cytochrome bc1 complex and cytochrome-c oxidase.

polypeptide.name: Cytochrome c-551
polypeptide.specific-function: Electron donor for cytochrome cd1 in nitrite and nitrate respiration.

polypeptide.name: Cytochrome c3
polypeptide.specific-function: Participates in sulfate respiration coupled with phosphorylation by transferring electrons from the enzyme dehydrogenase to ferredoxin.

polypeptide.name: Split-Soret cytochrome c
polypeptide.specific-function: Diheme cytochrome c which may be involved in sulfate reduction.

polypeptide.name: Group 1 truncated hemoglobin GlbN
polypeptide.general-function: Binds oxygen cooperatively with very high affinity (P(50) = 0.013 mmHg at 20 degrees Celsius) because of a fast combination (25 microM(-1).s(-1)) and a slow dissociation (0.2 s(-1)) rate.

go-classifier.description: evasion or tolerance by symbiont of host-produced nitric oxide

polypeptide.name: Cytochrome c-553
polypeptide.specific-function: Natural electron acceptor for a formate dehydrogenase.

polypeptide.name: Cytochrome P450 2C9
polypeptide.specific-function: Cytochromes P450 are a group of heme-thiolate monooxygenases. In liver microsomes, this enzyme is involved in an NADPH-dependent electron transport pathway. It oxidizes a variety of structurally unrelated compounds, including steroids, fatty acids, and xenobiotics. This enzyme contributes to the wide pharmacokinetics variability of the metabolism of drugs such as S-warfarin, diclofenac, phenytoin, tolbutamide and losartan.

go-classifier.description: oxidoreductase activity, acting on paired donors, with incorporation or reduction of molecular oxygen, reduced flavin or flavoprotein as one donor, and incorporation of one atom of oxygen

polypeptide.name: Nine-heme cytochrome c
polypeptide.specific-function: May form part of a transmembrane redox complex through which electrons are transferred to the cytoplasm for reduction of sulfate.

polypeptide.name: Cytochrome c3, 13 kDa
polypeptide.specific-function: Participates in sulfate respiration coupled with phosphorylation by transferring electrons from the enzyme dehydrogenase to ferredoxin.

target.name: Cytochrome c551 peroxidase
target.organism: Pseudomonas aeruginosa (strain ATCC 15692 / PAO1 / 1C / PRS 101 / LMG 12228)

polypeptide.name: Cytochrome c551 peroxidase
polypeptide.specific-function: Catalyzes the peroxidative oxidation of azurin and cytochrome c551. Likely to provide protection against toxic peroxides.
polypeptide.organism: Pseudomonas aeruginosa (strain ATCC 15692 / PAO1 / 1C / PRS 101 / LMG 12228)

polypeptide.name: Cytochrome c3
polypeptide.specific-function: Participates in sulfate respiration coupled with phosphorylation by transferring electrons from the enzyme dehydrogenase to ferredoxin.

polypeptide.name: Cytochrome c'
polypeptide.specific-function: Cytochrome c' is the most widely occurring bacterial c-type cytochrome. Cytochromes c' are high-spin proteins and the heme has no sixth ligand. Their exact function is not known.

target.name: Nitrite reductase
target.organism: Pseudomonas aeruginosa (strain ATCC 15692 / PAO1 / 1C / PRS 101 / LMG 12228)

polypeptide.organism: Pseudomonas aeruginosa (strain ATCC 15692 / PAO1 / 1C / PRS 101 / LMG 12228)

polypeptide.name: High-molecular-weight cytochrome c
polypeptide.specific-function: HMWC (high-molecular-weight cytochrome c), ORF2, ORF3, ORF4, ORF5 and ORF6 in the HMC operon form a transmembrane protein complex that allows electron flow from the periplasmic hydrogenase to the cytoplasmic enzymes that catalyze reduction of sulfates.

polypeptide.name: Quinohemoprotein ethanol dehydrogenase type-1
polypeptide.general-function: Oxidoreductase activity, acting on ch-oh group of donors
polypeptide.specific-function: Catalyzes the dye-linked oxidation of primary alcohols to the corresponding aldehydes and the (subsequent) oxidation of the aldehydes to carboxylic acids.

go-classifier.description: oxidoreductase activity, acting on CH-OH group of donors

polypeptide.name: Cytochrome c4
polypeptide.specific-function: Diheme, high potential cytochrome c believed to be an intermediate electron donor to terminal oxidation systems.

polypeptide.name: Cytochrome c
polypeptide.specific-function: Electron carrier protein. The oxidized form of the cytochrome c heme group can accept an electron from the heme group of the cytochrome c1 subunit of cytochrome reductase. Cytochrome c then transfers this electron to the cytochrome oxidase complex, the final protein carrier in the mitochondrial electron-transport chain.Plays a role in apoptosis. Suppression of the anti-apoptotic members or activation of the pro-apoptotic members of the Bcl-2 family leads to altered mitochondrial membrane permeability resulting in release of cytochrome c into the cytosol. Binding of cytochrome c to Apaf-1 triggers the activation of caspase-9, which then accelerates apoptosis by activating other caspases.

go-classifier.description: electron transporter, transferring electrons from CoQH2-cytochrome c reductase complex and cytochrome c oxidase complex activity
activation of cysteine-type endopeptidase activity involved in apoptotic process by cytochrome c
mitochondrial electron transport, cytochrome c to oxygen
mitochondrial electron transport, ubiquinol to cytochrome c
transcription initiation from RNA polymerase II promoter
